This is also the case in I200405282000 as well as I200405290105.

PB

This is hapeening with an existing workspace and user-defined formatter 
settings.   Just tried with new clean install and new workspace and seems OK.

PB

Created an attachment (id=11306)
org.eclipse.jdt.ui\code_formatter_profiles.xml

Here's my code_formatter_profiles.xml file in my workspace.

Created an attachment (id=11307)
plugins\org.eclipse.core.runtime\.settings\org.eclipse.jdt.ui.prefs

Here's my org.eclipse.jdt.ui.prefs file.

This is what I did to work around the problem:

1. In an older Eclipse build (M9), I exported my code formatter settings to 
file.

2. I then deleted the org.eclipse.jdt.ui\code_formatter_profiles.xml file in 
my workspace.

3. I launched I200405290105 using the old workspace, went to the Code 
Formatter Prefs page (which did not NPE now) and imported that profile.

It seems that I200405290105 is not using the code_formatter_profiles.xml file 
any more, but instead storing directly into the 
org.eclipse.core.runtime\.settings\org.eclipse.jdt.ui.prefs file.  This is a 
backward compatibility issue.

PB

Some comments:

- I can't reproduce this in I200405281200

- the NPE happens in code not developed by Eclipse. The NPE happens in code
  provided by the VM. Which VM are you using ? 

- you are correct that the data which formatter settings are choosen are now
  stored in the preference store and we had problems correctly converting
  this info in build I20040528_0800. As a result the settings were lost which
  might explain the behaviour. That's why JDT/UI gave a no go for this 
  build. Did you use that build ?
Doesn't happen on I200405290105 either.

I'm on 1.4.2_04.

I haven't used I20040528_0800.  Only I20040528_2000 and I20040529_0105.

Did you look at the attachments I provided?

PB

Yes I did, that's why I was asking which VM you are using. The outcome is:

Problem happens on Sun VM. I tested

java version "1.4.2"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2-b28)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2-b28, mixed mode)

but not on IBM VM started with -Xj9

java version "1.4.1"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.1)
Classic VM (build 1.4.1, J2RE 1.4.1 IBM Windows 32 build cn1411-20040511 (JIT 
enabled: jitc))

Steps to reproduce:

- create new workspace & shutdown
- copy code_formatter_profiles.xml into org.eclipse.jdt.ui
- copy org.eclipse.jdt.ui.prefs into org.eclipse.core.runtime\.settings
- restart Eclipse
- select code formatter pref page.

Once the page has been successfully opened it will open with the Sun VM as 
well.

Martin, we can you please investigate why this fails under Sun VM and if we 
can work around the failure.

RC2 candidate.

This has been fixed in Xalan 2.5.0.  You can find out the version of Xalan by 
invoking "java org.apache.xalan.Version".  In 1.4.2_04, Xalan is at 2.4.1.
The tracking bug report is http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?
id=18259.

However using Sun 1.4.2_04, I am getting
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.JavaUIException[4]: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: 
Illegal character at end of document, C.

*** Bug 65297 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 65483 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 65500 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 65513 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

A workaround: 

- Export your code formatter settings in the last version of Eclipse
- Delete the file code_formatter_profiles.xml in the workspace
- start RC1
- Open Code Formatter prefs
- Import the file

The workaround has been detailed in comment #5.

PB

fixed in 20040604 - 0800 build

Thanks Michael and Philipp for your help.

Addition to comment #5:

4. You may restore the old code_formatter_profiles.xml file after that, without
getting the NPE anymore in build 200405290105.
